article_title: Standard Chartered Adds Three to Board Financial Crime Committee
article_text: With the dollar’s strength against other major currencies, organizations are facing functional pressure to address related risks, including foreign exchange (FX) exposure identification and visibility. Currency exposures can hide in plain sight on a company’s balance sheet and within various intercompany transactions. As a result, organizations may want to consider seven areas of focus to help identify and address FX risks, including disparate treasury systems, inconsistent accounting and a lack of standard processes.

twitter.description: Standard Chartered PLC named three new advisers to its financial-crime board committee as it tries to bolster its controls against financial crime in the wake of multiple penalties from U.S. authorities.
